greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of fusenes of perimeter 2n (not necessarily planar) with bilateral symmetry, counted up to rotations.
comment: This sequence counts fusenes which stay the same when flipped over. Fusenes are like polyhexes with additional criteria that no holes are allowed, but on the other hand, helicene-like self-touching or self-overlapping configurations are included in the count here. Cf. the links and further comments at A258019.
For n >= 1, a(n) gives the total number of terms k in A258015 with binary width = 2n + 1, or equally, with A000523(k) = 2n.
link: Guo, Hansen, Zheng, Boundary uniqueness of fusenes, Discrete Applied Mathematics 118 (2002), pp. 209-222.
formula: Other identities and observations. For all n >= 1:
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 02 2015
